item.title: 拉加德称欧洲央行不久将启动政策战略评估
item.description: 欧洲央行行长克里斯蒂娜-拉加德（Christine Lagarde）表示，欧洲央行将 "合理地尽快 "开始研究其货币政策战略，预计明年下半年会有结果。【原文：The European Central Bank will “reasonably soon” start looking into its monetary-policy strategy — with results expected in the second half of next year, President Christine Lagarde said.】

item.title: 拉加德称欧洲央行 9 月利率会议将 "大开大合
item.description: 欧洲央行行长克里斯蒂娜-拉加德（Christine Lagarde）表示，欧洲央行的下一次利率会议将是 "大开大合 "的，尽管决策者们将掌握更多的信息来决定是否需要再次降息。【原文：The European Central Bank’s next interest-rate meeting will be “wide open,” though policymakers will have significantly more information on which to decide whether another cut is warranted, according to President Christine Lagarde.】

item.title: 土耳其讨好投资者的货币政策在国内遭到批评
item.description: 高利率和可预测货币的组合使土耳其成为外国投资者异常安全的赌注，但随着出口商业务流失和经济放缓，对这种组合的批评也越来越多。【原文：A combination of high interest rates and a predictable currency have made Turkey an unusually safe bet for foreign investors, but criticism of that mix is growing as exporters lose business and the economy slows.】

item.title: 据说阿达尼和威尔玛将为出售合资公司股权挑选银行
item.description: 据熟悉内情的人士透露，阿达尼企业有限公司（Adani Enterprises Ltd.）和威尔玛国际有限公司（Wilmar International Ltd.）已选择银行帮助出售其消费合资企业阿达尼威尔玛有限公司（Adani Wilmar Ltd.）的少数股权。【原文：Adani Enterprises Ltd. and Wilmar International Ltd. have selected banks to help with the sale of a minority stake in their consumer joint venture Adani Wilmar Ltd., according to people familiar with the matter.】

item.title: 英国金币销量因对工党财政计划的担忧而飙升
item.description: 由于投资者担心新一届工党政府可能会改变财政政策，英国皇家造币厂有限公司的免税金币销售量在上一季度大幅攀升。【原文：Sales of tax-exempt gold coins by the UK’s Royal Mint Ltd. jumped in the last quarter as investors fretted about potential changes to fiscal policy by an expected new Labour government.】

item.title: 南非央行维持关键利率不变，双方意见不一
item.description: 南非央行继续维持利率不变，理由是对通货膨胀的担忧挥之不去。【原文：South Africa’s central bank kept interest rates on hold, citing lingering concerns about inflation.】

item.title: 印度中央银行称必须降低通胀以维持增长
item.description: 印度央行表示，与其在短期内放宽货币政策以促进经济增长，不如集中精力将通胀率降至4%的目标。【原文：India’s central bank said it’s better to focus on bringing inflation down to the 4% target than to ease monetary policy to boost economic growth in the short term.】

item.title: Kraken 将加密货币机构服务扩展至英国和澳大利亚
item.description: 加密货币交易所 Kraken 最近推出的机构业务部门已开始为英国和澳大利亚的客户提供托管服务。【原文：Crypto exchange Kraken’s recently launched institutional business unit has begun offering custody services to customers in the UK and Australia.】

item.title: 土耳其加密货币平台首席执行官在全球推动下下台
item.description: 土耳其最大的加密货币交易所 BtcTurk 的负责人在执掌该公司七年后即将卸任，因为该公司计划向海外扩张。【原文：The head of Turkey’s biggest cryptocurrency exchange BtcTurk is stepping down after seven years at the helm, as the firm plans an expansion abroad.】

item.title: 英国 Pret A Manger 撤销 "免费 "咖啡订购，做出重大转变
item.description: Pret A Manger 取消了为顾客提供 "免费 "饮品的咖啡订购服务，取消了在大流行病期间推出的让人们重新走进店门的优惠活动。【原文：Pret A Manger has scrapped its coffee subscription that gave customers “free” drinks, unwinding an offer launched during the pandemic to get people back through its doors.】

item.title: 英国央行正在审查银行保证金规则，以阻止另一场 "阿尔切戈斯 "事件的发生
item.description: 英国监管机构正在审查银行在决定向客户要求多少保证金时所采用的政策，因为他们希望避免再次发生类似 Archegos Capital Management 内爆的事件，该事件导致整个行业损失数十亿美元，并使瑞士信贷陷入危机，最终导致其倒闭。【原文：UK regulators are examining the policies banks use when deciding how much margin to demand from clients as they look to avoid another incident like the implosion of Archegos Capital Management, which cost the industry billions of dollars and plunged Credit Suisse into a crisis that ultimately led to its collapse.】

item.title: Transnet 获得非洲开发银行 10 亿美元贷款，用于资助复苏计划
item.description: 非洲开发银行批准向南非国有港口和铁路运营商提供 10 亿美元贷款，帮助其实施振兴濒临破产的基础设施和扩大业务的计划。【原文：The African Development Bank approved a $1 billion loan for South Africa’s state-owned ports and rail operator to help fund its plan to revive ailing infrastructure and expand its business.】

item.title: 欧洲央行维持利率不变，下次降息需更多数据支持
item.description: 欧洲中央银行在上个月具有里程碑意义的降息后保持利率不变；在投资者和经济学家押注 9 月份再次降息时，欧洲中央银行几乎没有透露任何计划。【原文：The European Central Bank left interest rates unchanged after last month’s landmark cut — giving away little on its plans as investors and economists bet on another move in September.】

item.title: 意大利可再生能源首次超过化石燃料
item.description: 根据国家电网运营商的数据，今年上半年，意大利的可再生能源发电量超过了化石燃料发电量，水力发电活动更加活跃。【原文：Italy’s power generation from renewables overtook fossil fuel sources in the first half of the year amid stronger hydropower activity, according to the national grid operator.】

item.title: 中国大型政策会议将令金属多头失望
item.description:
中国政府可能会扩大政策范围，削弱其在制定钢铁、铜和铝价格方面的主导地位。【原文：

Beijing will likely extend policies that erode its dominance in setting prices for steel, copper and aluminum.

】

item.title: 高盛顶级股票分析师正等待人工智能泡沫破裂
item.description: 吉姆-科维洛（Jim Covello）在华尔街摸爬滚打了三十多年，深知与不断膨胀的科技股泡沫对赌是多么痛苦。市场有办法月复一月地创造财富，即使最新的突破显然没有达到预期的效果。【原文：Over three decades on Wall Street, Jim Covello has learned how painful it can be to bet against an inflating tech stock bubble. The market has a way of minting riches, month after month, even after it’s clear the latest breakthroughs aren’t playing out quite as expected.】

item.title: 收入增加后印度或将小幅削减预算赤字目标
item.description: 据熟悉内情的人士透露，印度总理纳伦德拉-莫迪（Narendra Modi）领导的政府可能会略微降低财政赤字目标，这表明政府有意控制财政状况，因为外界对盟国提出越来越多要求的猜测越来越多。【原文：Prime Minister Narendra Modi’s government will likely reduce its fiscal deficit target slightly, according to people familiar with the matter, signaling an intent to keep a grip on finances as speculation grows about increasing demands from allies.】

item.title: 私人债务、银行争相为 Hargreaves Lansdown 私有化提供资金
item.description: 知情人士称，银行和私人信贷基金正竞相提供多达 17.5 亿英镑（23 亿美元）的资金，以支持 Hargreaves Lansdown 可能的私有化。【原文：Banks and private credit funds are competing to provide as much as £1.75 billion ($2.3 billion) to back a possible take-private of Hargreaves Lansdown, people with knowledge of the matter said.】

item.title: 干旱过后，津巴布韦半数农村人口面临饥饿问题
item.description: 一份新的报告显示，在厄尔尼诺引发的干旱导致农作物减产之后，到明年第一季度，津巴布韦一半以上的农村人口将面临粮食不安全问题。【原文：More than half of Zimbabwe’s rural population faces food insecurity by the first quarter of next year after an El Nino-induced drought slashed crop output, a new report showed.】

item.title: 交易员等待欧洲央行利率决定
item.description: 法兰克福中央商务区的摩天大楼。摄影师亚历克斯-克劳斯【原文：Skyscrapers in the central business district of Frankfurt. Photographer: Alex Kraus】

item.title: D.R. Horton 在房价高企的季度订单量未达预期
item.description: 房屋建筑商D.R. Horton Inc.公布的季度订单量低于预期，原因是持续走高的抵押贷款利率给该公司专注的入门级市场带来了压力。【原文：Homebuilder D.R. Horton Inc. reported weaker-than-expected quarterly orders as persistently high mortgage rates pressured the entry-level market the company focuses on.】

item.title: 随着更多风电场停运，德国的风力发电目标受到威胁
item.description: 补贴计划结束后，德国拔掉的陆上风力发电场的插头数量首次超过了增加的数量，但在实现雄心勃勃的气候目标的竞赛中，德国仍然扩大了其最重要能源的产能。【原文：Germany unplugged more onshore wind farms than it added for the first time ever after subsidy programs ended, yet the nation still expanded capacity of its most important energy source in the race to meet ambitious climate targets.】

item.title: 房地产退出放缓，Blackstone 利润不及预期
item.description: 由于高利率压低了房地产估值，投资者对房地产业务的投入减少，Blackstone Inc.【原文：Blackstone Inc.’s real estate arm weighed on the investment giant’s second-quarter results, as high interest rates crimped property valuations and investors pumped less money into the business.】

item.title: 古根海姆高管建造数百万套新房的大计划
item.description:
房利美和房地美有可能发挥强大的新作用。【原文：

A potentially powerful new role for Fannie and Freddie.

】

item.title: 吉姆-米尔斯坦（Jim Millstein）谈可增加数百万套住房的想法
item.description:
房利美和房地美能否启动多户住宅建设？【原文：

Can Fannie and Freddie jump start multi-family construction?

】

item.title: 开始一天生活所需的五件事美洲
item.description: 早上好。科技股将迎来反弹，欧洲央行将确定利率。以下是交易员们正在谈论的话题。【原文：Good morning. Tech shares are set for a rebound and the European Central Bank sets rates. Here’s what traders are talking about. — David Goodman】

item.title: 需求不温不火，美国天气良好，大豆跌幅扩大
item.description: 在芝加哥，大豆跌幅扩大，创下近四年来的新低，原因是对美国大豆的需求不温不火，且当地农作物天气良好。【原文：Soybeans extended a drop to an almost four-year low in Chicago amid tepid demand for US beans and good weather for crops there.】

item.title: 梅赛德斯和 Stellantis 正在商谈支持塞尔维亚的锂业雄心
item.description: 梅赛德斯-奔驰集团（Mercedes-Benz Group AG）和 Stellantis NV 公司正在与塞尔维亚政府商讨投资锂加工和电动汽车电池生产，这可能会为可能成为欧洲最大锂矿的项目提供新的支持。【原文：Mercedes-Benz Group AG and Stellantis NV are in discussions with Serbia’s government to invest in lithium-processing and EV battery production, potentially adding fresh support for what may become Europe’s biggest lithium mine.】

item.title: 丹格特称尼日利亚大型炼油厂已被当地原油价格所取代
item.description: 尼日利亚新的巨型炼油厂运营商称，当地原油价格正在上涨，迫使该厂依赖国外供应。【原文：Nigeria’s giant new refinery is being priced out of local crude, forcing the plant to rely on supplies from abroad, according to its operator.】

item.title: 可再生能源激增，德国电力交易接近三个月低点
item.description: 由于可再生能源充斥市场，而工业需求恢复缓慢，德国年前电力交易接近三个月来的最低点。【原文：German year-ahead power traded near the lowest in three months as renewable energy is flooding the market and industrial demand is slow to recover.】
